member.name: T:MicroServer.Threading.WaitCallback
member.summary: Represents a callback method to be executed by a thread pool thread.
member.param: An object containing information to be used by the callback method.

member.name: T:MicroServer.Threading.ThreadPool
member.summary: Provides a pool of threads that can be used to execute tasks, post work items, process asynchronous I/O, wait on behalf of other threads, and process timers.
member.remarks: Because the maximum number of threads used by the ThreadPool only short running operations should be executed by using it. Multiple long running operations would block the available threads. New operations will not be called at all if all threads are blocked.

member.name: M:MicroServer.Threading.ThreadPool.QueueUserWorkItem(MicroServer.Threading.WaitCallback)
member.summary: Queues a method for execution. The method executes when a thread pool thread becomes available.
member.param: A WaitCallback that represents the method to be executed.
member.returns: true if the method is successfully queued.

member.name: M:MicroServer.Threading.ThreadPool.QueueUserWorkItem(MicroServer.Threading.WaitCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Queues a method for execution, and specifies an object containing data to be used by the method. The method executes when a thread pool thread becomes available.
member.param: A WaitCallback representing the method to execute.
An object containing data to be used by the method.
member.returns: true if the method is successfully queued.

member.name: M:MicroServer.Threading.ThreadPool.GetMinThreads
member.summary: Retrieves the minimum number of threads the thread pool creates on demand.
member.returns: Returns the minimum number of worker threads that the thread pool creates on demand.

member.name: M:MicroServer.Threading.ThreadPool.SetMinThreads(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the minimum number of threads the thread pool creates on demand.
member.param: The minimum number of worker threads that the thread pool creates on demand.
member.returns: true if the change is successful; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:MicroServer.Threading.ThreadPool.GetMaxThreads
member.summary: Retrieves the number of requests to the thread pool that can be active concurrently. All requests above that number remain queued until thread pool threads become available.
member.returns: The maximum number of asynchronous I/O threads in the thread pool.

member.name: M:MicroServer.Threading.ThreadPool.SetMaxThreads(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the number of requests to the thread pool that can be active concurrently. All requests above that number remain queued until thread pool threads become available.
member.param: The maximum number of worker threads in the thread pool.
member.returns: true if the change is successful; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:MicroServer.Threading.ThreadPool.Shutdown
member.summary: Shuts down all threads after they have finished theire work.

member.name: E:MicroServer.Threading.ThreadPool.UnhandledThreadPoolException
member.summary: Is fired when a excption in one of the worker threads in unhandeld.

The amount of digits it should be
The character to repeat in front (default: 0)
member.returns: A string with the right amount of digits

The amount of digits it should be
The character to repeat in front (default: 0)
member.returns: A string with the right amount of digits

member.summary: Replace all occurances of the 'find' string with the 'replace' string.
member.param: Original string
String to find within the original string
String to be used in place of the find string
member.returns: Final string after all instances have been replaced.

member.name: M:MicroServer.Utilities.StringUtility.ReplaceEmptyOrNull(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Finds and replaces empty or null within a string
member.returns: source

member.name: M:MicroServer.Utilities.StringUtility.ReplaceEmptyOrNull(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Finds and replaces empty or null within a string
member.returns: Value

member.name: M:MicroServer.Utilities.StringUtility.Sort(System.String[])
member.summary: Sorts an array of strings.
member.remarks: Original code by user "Jay Jay" http://www.tinyclr.com/codeshare/entry/475 Modified to be specifically suites to sorting arrays of strings.
member.param: Array of string to be sorted.

member.name: M:MicroServer.Utilities.StringUtility.Sort(System.String[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This is a generic version of C.A.R Hoare's Quick Sort algorithm. This will handle arrays that are already sorted, and arrays with duplicate keys.
member.remarks: If you think of a one dimensional array as going from the lowest index on the left to the highest index on the right then the parameters to this function are lowest index or left and highest index or right. The first time you call this function it will be with the parameters 0, a.length - 1.
member.param: Array of string to be sorted.
Left boundary of array partition
Right boundary of array partition

member.name: M:MicroServer.Utilities.StringUtility.Format(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Replaces one or more format items in a specified string with the string representation of a specified object.
member.param: A composite format string.
The object to format.
member.returns: A copy of format in which any format items are replaced by the string representation of arg0.
member.exception: format is invalid, or the index of a format item is less than zero, or greater than or equal to the length of the args array.

member.name: M:MicroServer.Utilities.StringUtility.Format(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Format the given string using the provided collection of objects.
member.param: A composite format string.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to format.
member.returns: A copy of format in which the format items have been replaced by the string representation of the corresponding objects in args.
member.exception: format is invalid, or the index of a format item is less than zero, or greater than or equal to the length of the args array.

member.name: T:MicroServer.Utilities.FormatException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the format of an argument does not meet the parameter specifications of the invoked method.

member.name: M:MicroServer.Utilities.FormatException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the FormatException class.

member.name: M:MicroServer.Utilities.FormatException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the FormatException class with a specified error message.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.name: M:MicroServer.Utilities.FormatException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the FormatException class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.
